column4: how do you configure the soundcard, my system beeps but it says there's no soundcard (even though it shows up in the system configuration/device mgr. as a NeoMagic 2360 [MagicMedia 256ZX audio]
I've already tried the noacpi options
did you check applications->multimedia->volume control and see that things aren't muted?
was it a straight ubuntu install?
can you run sudo lspci at a terminal and tell us the line for your card?
ah, did the other machine not have a sound card?
can you check here: http://alsa-project.org/alsa-doc/ to see if your card is listed?
with your usb cdrom, does it appear when you plug it in in "disks"?
it doesn't appear, but there's already a CD-rom there (even though there's none in my system)
you mean the cdrom doesn't appear?
it does not appear
so is there no alsa support for your card?
can you check what your /etc/fstab says about your cdrom?
ALSA site says "[X?]  Support undetermined."
check flood for my /etc/fstab
there's no line in /etc/fstab about a cdrom?
/dev/hdc        /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 ro,user,noauto  0       0
if you plug in your usb drive, does it appear in computer->system conf->device manager?
it does show in device mangaer
are you in group plugdev? from terminal, "groups"
yes
